material-property-value-condition.content:
Please analyze the following paragraph and summarize the properties, including their numerical values, of the mentioned materials.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone. 18 In a closer look of the film absorptions , it is also found that the full width at half - maximum ( fwhm ) of PCDSeBT ( 155 nm ) is wider than that of PDCTBT ( 140 nm ) , as a matter of a characteristic of strong intermolecular Se°°°Se interactions , which can potentially further increase J SC value. The electrochemical properties of PCDSeBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). As shown in Figure 1b , PCDSeBT exhibits clear reversible n - doping / dedoping processes in the negative potential range , whereas quasi-reversible p - doping / dedoping behaviors in the positive potential range are observed. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels are estimated to be -5.40 eV and -3.70 eV , respectively , using the ferrocene - ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc+ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ). Both PCDTBT and PCDSeBT have nearly identical HOMO energy levels , but PCDSeBT exhibits 0.10 eV lower - lying LUMO level relative to PCDTBT ( LUMO = -3.60 eV , see also Supporting Information ) , 5a verifying our presumption aforementioned about the effect of selenium on the selective fine - tuning of LUMO level. The material - design rules described by Scharber et al. 19 suggested that the PCEs of a BHJ solar cell should be much more sensitive to changes of the donor LUMO level compared to variations of the donor bandgap. On the basis of the rules , the estimated PCE from the E g opt and the LUMO value of PCDSeBT is 7.8% . This theoretical value is much higher than that of PCDTBT ( 6.5% ) , indicating that a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies. Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ). The HOMO of PCDSeBT is well - distributed along the conjugated chains ; its LUMO is mainly centralized on BT accepting core as shaped by orbital lobes , being predicted a p - type organic semiconductor. In order to corroborate the effect of the heteroatom substitution on charge transporting properties of the polymers , top - contact organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) were fabricated using solution processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT , respectively , as the semiconducting layer on the octadecyltrichlorosilane ( OTS ) self - assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified Si / SiO 2 substrates ( see the detailed devices fabrication in the Experimental Section ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Optical bandgap:
The replacement of thiophene with selenophene reduces the optical bandgap, indicating that the material has become more conductive.
2. Full width at half-maximum (fwhm):
The fwhm of PCDSeBT (155 nm) is wider than that of PDCTBT (140 nm), indicating stronger intermolecular interactions in PCDSeBT.
3. Electrochemical properties:
PCDSeBT exhibits clear reversible n-doping/dedoping processes in the negative potential range and quasi-reversible p-doping/dedoping behaviors in the positive potential range.
4. HOMO and LUMO energy levels:
The HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT is estimated to be -5.40 eV, and the LUMO energy level is estimated to be -3.70 eV, which is 0.10 eV lower than that of PCDTBT.
5. Material design rules:
According to the material design rules described by Scharber et al., the PCEs of a BHJ solar cell should be more sensitive to changes of the donor LUMO level compared to variations of the donor bandgap.
6. Estimated PCE:
The estimated PCE of PCDSeBT is 7.8%, which is higher than that of PCDTBT (6.5%), indicating that PCDSeBT is a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies.
7. Molecular geometry and frontier molecular orbitals:
The optimized molecular geometry and frontier molecular orbitals of PCDSeBT were computed by density functional theory (DFT). The HOMO of PCDSeBT is well-distributed along the conjugated chains, while the LUMO is mainly centralized on the BT accepting core.
8. Charge transporting properties:
Top-contact organic field-effect transistors (OFETs) were fabricated using solution-processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT as the semiconducting layer. The results showed that PCDSeBT exhibits better charge transporting properties than PCDTBT.

In summary, the replacement of thiophene with selenophene in PCDSeBT results in a reduction of the optical bandgap, stronger intermolecular interactions, and better charge transporting properties. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels of PCDSeBT are estimated to be -5.40 eV and -3.70 eV, respectively, which are similar to those of PCDTBT. However, the LUMO energy level of PCDSeBT is 0.10 eV lower than that of PCDTBT, which is beneficial for photovoltaic performance. The estimated PCE of PCDSeBT is 7.8%, which is higher than that of PCDTBT (6.5%), indicating that PCDSeBT is a promising material for PSCs.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Material Name', 'Material Property', 'Material Property (Abbr.)', 'Numerical Value', 'Condition']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

| Material Name | Material Property | Material Property (Abbr.) | Numerical Value | Condition |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PCDSeBT | Optical bandgap | E_g | 1.35 eV | Lower than PCDTBT |
| PCDSeBT | Full width at half-maximum | fwhm | 155 nm | Wider than PCDTBT |
| PCDSeBT | HOMO energy level | HOMO | -5.40 eV | Similar to PCDTBT |
| PCDSeBT | LUMO energy level | LUMO | -3.70 eV | Lower than PCDTBT |
| PCDSeBT | PCE | PCE | 7.8% | Higher than PCDTBT |

Note: PCDSeBT stands for poly[bis(ethylene glycol) phenylene-co-selenophene-co-thiophene], PCDTBT stands for poly[bis(ethylene glycol) phenylene-co-thiophene-co-thiophene].
